hazard noun [C]
(GOLF)
an area of a golf course (= area of land used for playing golf) that provides an obstacle (= something that blocks you so that movement, going forward, or action is made more difficult): In golf, hazards are just another part of the game. The golf course now features the most dramatic water hazards.
More examplesFewer examplesSand traps, mounds, and water hazards are frequent on these courses.Some golf carts include GPS receivers to tell golfers the distance to the next hole and the location of hazards.Additional hazards are provided by the 80 sand bunkers dotted along the fairways and greens.
